description:
Studies of trends and themes in the modern American novel. Topics in the past have included "California Dreaming," studying novels set in California such as THE LAST TYCOON, THE BIG SLEEP, RUN RIVER, THE CRYING of LOT 49 and others: William Faulkner; and "The Work, the Life, the Community: Eight American Literary Artists," which focused on Fitzgerald, Hemingway, Mailer, and others in their cultural context. 

See the English Department's website at www.english.upenn.edu for a description of the current offerings.
name: MOURNING AND MEMORY
